New Records: Harry Palmer scored a penalty in the 60th minute for England's first goal against Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored in the 85th minute for England's second goal against Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Harry Kane scored in the 89th minute for England's third goal against Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Key Match Events: England won the match 3-0 against Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Guehi and Branthwaite received yellow cards for England.
Tahirovic and Gazibegovic received yellow cards for Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Pre-Game Insights: Seven England players were absent from training before the match due to injury or club commitments.
Harry Maguire and Luke Shaw were nursing calf and thigh problems respectively.
Anthony Gordon was not present on the grass with his teammates due to an ankle injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate's men secured a 3-0 win over Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The England boss will have to trim his preliminary squad of 33 players down to a minimum of 23 and a maximum of 26 players by June 7.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at St. James' Park with a 7.45pm UK kick-off.
The England team will return to their usual Wembley base for the visit of Iceland next Friday.
Others: The England team will jet off to Germany to tackle Serbia, Denmark, and Slovenia in Euro 2024 Group C.
